item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (46 points | 6 comments)
2. Amazon employees: 'I'd rather go back to school than work in an office again' (75 points | 42 comments)
3. "Four Seconds to Hot Up the Disintegrator, Google Had Told Me It Wasn't Enough" (212 points | 80 comments)
4. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (48 points | 21 comments)
5. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (165 points | 11 comments)
6. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (62 points | 46 comments)
7. Leaked Files from Putin Troll Factory:How Russia Manipulated European Elections (37 points | 3 comments)
8. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (29 points | 5 comments)
9. Cloudflare Network Issues Affecting Service Reachability (6 points | 1 comment)
10. The Centrality of Stupidity in Mathematics (170 points | 91 comments)
11. We are self-hosting our GPUs (43 points | 31 comments)
12. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (98 points | 54 comments)
13. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (153 points | 26 comments)
14. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (440 points | 82 comments)
15. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (121 points | 874 comments)
16. Signatures of Gravitational Atoms from Black Hole Mergers (73 points | 29 comments)
17. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (44 points | 9 comments)
18. What Researchers Learned from the Oldest Cookbook (7 points | 1 comment)
19. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (3 points | 1 comment)
20. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (44 points | 8 comments)
21. A Curried Composition Puzzle (64 points | 6 comments)
22. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (67 points | 25 comments)
23. Some remarks on the mathematical structure of the multiverse (13 points | 2 comments)
24. Not a Normal Field Trip (12 points | 1 comment)
25. An interactive core memory electronic kit (34 points | 2 comments)
26. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (63 points | 41 comments)
27. Tiny Trackers Are Revealing the Secret Lives of Birds (42 points | 15 comments)
28. Rio-labs/rio: WebApps in pure Python. No JavaScript, HTML and CSS needed (130 points | 118 comments)
29. IBM acquires Kubecost (41 points | 17 comments)
30. The Theft of a Priceless Churchill Portrait (43 points | 19 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
